login.subtitle: Please enter your credentials.

agentView.title: Agent Interface
agentView.noScript: This campaign has no associated script.
agentView.scriptWillBeHere: The script will be displayed here.

users.title: Users
users.description: Manage user accounts, their roles, and permissions.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Adding an Agent
steps: The administrator clicks 'Add User'.
They fill in the agent's information (first name, last name, login ID).
They assign the 'Agent' role and choose the campaigns the agent will participate in.
A password is generated and the administrator saves.
The agent can now log in with their credentials.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Each user must have a unique login ID (4-6 digits).
Three roles available: Agent, Supervisor, Administrator.
Administrators can view and modify everything.
Supervisors can view dashboards and coach agents.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: For a quick demo, use the 'Bulk Generate' feature to create 10 test agents in one click, automatically assigning them IDs and passwords.

groups.title: Groups
groups.description: Create agent groups for simplified management and routing.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Creating an 'Experts' Group
steps: The administrator goes to 'Agent Groups' and clicks 'Create Group'.
They name the group 'Product A Experts'.
They select the agents certified for Product A from the list.
They save the group.
This group can now be used as a destination in an IVR.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: An agent can belong to multiple groups.
Groups can be used for routing incoming calls.
Groups can be used to filter reports.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: Start with a single 'General' group containing all your agents. You can create more specific groups later as your routing needs become more complex.

planning.title: Schedules
planning.description: Create and manage weekly agent schedules and their activities.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Scheduling a Training Session
steps: The supervisor goes to the 'Schedules' menu.
They navigate to the desired week.
They click on the Wednesday 2:00 PM slot.
In the window that opens, they select the agent 'Alice'.
They choose the 'Training' activity and adjust the end time to 4:00 PM.
They save, and the new event appears in color on the calendar.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Weekly calendar view.
Filter by agent or view all agents.
Customizable activity types with color codes.
Create, modify, and delete events via a modal interface.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: Start by defining a few basic activity types like 'Outbound Calls', 'Lunch Break', and 'Meeting'. You can then refine the schedules with more specific activities.

outbound.title: Outbound Campaigns
outbound.description: Create and manage outbound call campaigns with advanced dialing strategies.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Launching a Prospecting Campaign
steps: The manager clicks 'Create Campaign'.
They name the campaign, choose the agent script and qualification group.
They define the schedule (calling days/hours).
They configure the strategy (dialing mode, retry attempts).
They import a CSV contact list.
They activate the campaign. The system starts distributing calls to agents.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Dialing modes: Predictive, Progressive, Manual.
Fine-grained management of automatic retries based on call qualifications.
Configuration of the displayed number (Caller ID).
Configurable answering machine detection (AMD).

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: To start, use 'Progressive' mode. It's simpler than predictive and ensures an agent is always available for each connected call, avoiding abandoned calls.

scripts.title: Agent Scripts
scripts.description: Build interactive call guides for your agents with a visual editor.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Creating a Sales Script
steps: The supervisor clicks 'Create New Script'.
They drag and drop a 'Title' block for the opening, then a 'Text' block for the pitch.
They add an 'Input Field' to note the contact's name.
They add a 'Single Choice' to qualify the prospect's interest.
They save the script, which becomes available for call campaigns.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Visual drag-and-drop editor.
Conditional logic to show/hide blocks (coming soon).
Real-time preview of the agent interface.
Wide range of field types: texts, inputs, multiple choice, dates, etc.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: Don't try to create a perfect script on the first try. Start with a few simple text blocks for the key conversation points. The goal is to guide, not to force the agent to read a script word for word.

ivr.title: IVR Flows
ivr.description: Design complex inbound call flows with a graphical designer.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Creating a Welcome IVR
steps: The admin clicks 'Create New Flow'.
They connect the 'Start' node to a 'Media' node and type the welcome message.
They connect the 'Media' to a 'Menu' node ('Press 1 for sales, 2 for support').
They connect option '1' to a 'Transfer' node to the 'Sales' agent group.
They connect option '2' to another 'Transfer' node to the 'Support' group.
They save the flow. It can now be assigned to a number.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Visual node-based editor (connections between blocks).
Available nodes: Media, Menu, Transfer, Voicemail, Hangup, Calendar.
The 'Calendar' node allows routing calls differently based on business hours.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: Your first IVR can be very simple: a 'Media' node (welcome message) directly connected to a 'Transfer' node to your main agent group. This already professionalizes how your callers are greeted.

audio.title: Media Library
audio.description: Import and manage voice prompts for your IVRs and hold music.

userJourney.title: Journey: Updating the Welcome Message
steps: The marketing department has recorded a new message for Christmas promotions.
The admin goes to 'Audio Management', clicks 'Import File'.
They name the file 'welcome_christmas_2024' and select the MP3 file.
They then go to the IVR editor, select the welcome 'Media' node.
They choose the new 'welcome_christmas_2024' file from the dropdown list.

specs.title: Specifications
points: Supports WAV and MP3 formats.
Automatic conversion to the optimal format for telephony.
Files can be listened to directly from the interface.
Organization by folders for complex projects.

simplificationTip.title: Tip
simplificationTip.content: If you don't have pre-recorded messages, it's not a problem. IVR nodes can use Text-to-Speech to read any message you type.

records.title: Recordings
records.description: Listen, download, and archive call recordings for quality and compliance.

userJourney.title: Journey: Reviewing a Call for Coaching
steps: A supervisor wants to listen to the call of an agent who had difficulties.
They go to 'Recordings' and filter by the agent's name and yesterday's date.
They find the relevant call in the list and click the 'Play' icon.
The recording is played directly in the browser.
They can then download the file to archive or share it.

specs.title: Specifications
points: Search by date, agent, campaign, phone number.
Integrated audio player.
Download recordings in MP3 format.
Automatic archiving after a configurable period.

simplificationTip.title: Tip
simplificationTip.content: Recording activation is done at the level of each outbound campaign or on each inbound queue. Make sure to enable the option where you need it.

qualifications.title: Call Qualifications
qualifications.description: Define call-end statuses for reporting and retry strategies.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Creating a Qualification Group
steps: The supervisor clicks 'Create Group'.
They name the group 'Product A Sales'.
They add custom qualifications like 'Interested - Call Back' or 'Not Interested - Budget'.
They assign these new qualifications to the group, in addition to standard qualifications (Answering Machine, No Answer...).
The group is saved and can be assigned to an outbound call campaign.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Qualifications are grouped into 'Qualification Groups'.
Types of qualifications: Positive, Negative, Neutral.
Only neutral and negative qualifications can be used for automatic retries.
Some qualifications (Answering Machine, No Answer...) are standard and included in all groups.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: Start with a single 'General' group. Simply add the 2 or 3 most important qualifications for your business (e.g., 'Sale Made', 'Appointment Booked').

supervision.title: Real-Time Supervision
supervision.description: View your contact center's activity live and interact with agents.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Coaching an Agent in Difficulty
steps: The supervisor sees in the dashboard that an agent has been on a call for a very long time.
They click on the 'Agents' tab to see more details.
They click the 'Listen' icon next to the agent to listen to the call discreetly.
They realize the agent is stuck. They click 'Coaching' to speak to the agent without the customer hearing.
They guide the agent to successfully conclude the call.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Data updates every 2 seconds via WebSocket (simulated).
Main KPIs: Agents by status, calls waiting, max wait time.
Supervision actions: Listen, Coaching (whisper), Intervention (barge).
Detailed view by agent, by call, and by campaign.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: The 'Live' view gives a quick global overview of the contact center's health. It's the first screen to look at to quickly detect a problem (e.g., too many agents on break, a call waiting for too long).

reporting.title: Reports & Analytics
reporting.description: Explore historical data, create custom reports, and export results.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Generating a Weekly Performance Report
steps: The manager goes to the 'Reports' section.
They use the filters to select the 'last 7 days' period and the 'Q4 Sales' campaign.
They consult the global KPIs and the performance tables by agent.
They view the charts to identify trends.
Satisfied with the data, they click 'Export to PDF' to generate a complete report to share.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Powerful filtering by period, agent, and campaign.
Pivot tables to analyze performance.
Interactive charts for data visualization.
Export reports in PDF format.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: Use the predefined periods ('last 7 days', 'This month') for quick access to the most common data. Custom dates are there for more in-depth analysis.

history.title: Call History
history.description: Consult, filter, and search the detailed log of all inbound and outbound calls.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Searching for a Specific Call
steps: A customer calls to complain about a conversation that took place yesterday.
The supervisor goes to 'Call History'.
They use the date filters to select yesterday.
They enter the customer's phone number in the search bar.
The corresponding call instantly appears, with the agent who handled it and its qualification.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Display of the complete communication history (inbound/outbound calls).
Multiple filters: by direction, by date/time range.
Unified search field: search by number, agent name, or campaign name.
Pagination to handle large volumes of data (coming soon).
Link to the call recording (coming soon).

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: The date filter is the most powerful to start with. By default, it displays today's calls, giving you a quick view of the day's activity without having to navigate complex reports.

sessions.title: Agent Login/Logout
sessions.description: Consult the detailed log of agent connections, disconnections, and work times.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Checking an Agent's Hours
steps: A manager wants to check the connection hours of agent 'Alice'.
They go to the 'Agent Login/Logout' menu.
They use the filters to select yesterday.
They enter 'Alice' in the search bar to filter the results.
The table displays all of Alice's sessions for the day, with her total connection time.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Each agent connection/disconnection generates an entry.
Filters by date range and agent name.
Detailed display of each session (start, end, duration).
Summary panel displaying the total work time per agent over the selected period.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: The date filter is the most powerful. Leave the search empty to see the activity of all agents over the chosen period and quickly identify overall trends.

trunks.title: SIP Trunks
trunks.description: Connect your telephone operators for inbound and outbound calls.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Configuring a New Operator
steps: The technician receives the SIP credentials from the operator.
They go to 'SIP Trunks' and click 'Add Trunk'.
They name the trunk (e.g., 'Main Operator'), and enter the provided domain, login, and password.
They save the configuration.
The system registers with the operator and is ready to receive calls.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Supports authentication by login/password.
Each trunk is registered individually with the operator.
Numbers (DIDs) are then associated with a specific trunk.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: All the complexity of SIP configuration (codecs, timeouts, etc.) is handled automatically. You only need the 4 main pieces of information from your provider.

dids.title: Numbers (DIDs)
dids.description: Manage your incoming phone numbers and their initial routing.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Routing a Support Number
steps: The admin goes to 'Numbers (DIDs)' and clicks 'Add'.
They enter the phone number (e.g., 0123456789) and a description ('Technical Support').
They select the SIP Trunk through which this number arrives.
In 'Destination', they choose the previously created 'Main IVR' flow.
They save. Any call to this number will now be handled by the IVR.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Each number must be unique.
A number is associated with a single SIP Trunk.
The destination can be an IVR or directly a campaign/group (future functionality).

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: Make sure you have created at least one SIP Trunk and one IVR flow before adding a number, as these are mandatory fields for routing.

sites-config.title: Site Configuration
sites-config.description: Manage different physical sites for outbound call routing.

userJourney.title: User Journey: Adding a New Branch
steps: The administrator goes to 'Site Configuration'.
They click 'Add Site'.
They name the site 'Lyon Branch'.
They save. The site is now available to assign agents to.
The system will use this site to route outbound calls through the correct telephone gateway.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Each site must have a unique name.
A site is used by Asterisk to select the correct outbound Trunk.
Deleting a site will automatically unassign any agents linked to it.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: Even if you only have one physical location, create a 'Main' site. This prepares your configuration for future expansion and ensures proper call routing.

module-settings.title: Module Management
module-settings.description: Enable or disable menus for Administrator and Supervisor roles.

userJourney.title: Journey: Hiding Audio Management
steps: The SuperAdmin goes to 'Settings' > 'Module Management'.
They locate the 'Sound' category or the 'Media Library' submenu.
They disable the corresponding switch.
They save the changes.
Users with the 'Administrator' role will no longer see this menu.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Access to this page is strictly reserved for users with the 'SuperAdmin' role.
Visibility changes do not affect SuperAdmins.
Disabling a category hides all its submenus.
Settings are saved and applied to all future sessions of the affected users.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: For a new client, start by hiding all non-essential modules to simplify onboarding. You can reactivate them progressively based on their needs.

languages.title: Languages
languages.description: Manage the languages available in the application.

userJourney.title: Journey: Changing the Interface Language
steps: The user clicks on the language selector in the header.
They choose 'Français' from the dropdown list.
The entire interface is instantly translated into French.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: The language choice is saved in the browser's local storage.
Adding new languages is done by creating a new JSON translation file.

simplificationTip.title: Tip
simplificationTip.content: This module is a placeholder. Active language management is done via the selector in the header for quick access.

database-client.title: Database
database-client.description: Execute SQL queries directly on the database for debugging and advanced reporting.

userJourney.title: Journey: Checking Imported Contacts
steps: The SuperAdmin suspects a problem with the last contact import.
They go to 'Settings' > 'Database'.
They click on the predefined query 'List the last 20 contacts'.
The query `SELECT * FROM contacts ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT 20;` appears in the editor.
They execute the query and examine the results in the table to confirm the data.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Access reserved for users with the 'SuperAdmin' role.
'Read-Only' mode is enabled by default to prevent accidental modifications.
Backend query validation to block dangerous commands in read-only mode.
Dynamic display of results in a table.

simplificationTip.title: Security Tip
simplificationTip.content: Always use predefined queries when possible. Only disable 'Read-Only' mode when absolutely necessary and after double-checking your `UPDATE` or `DELETE` query, especially the `WHERE` clause.

system-connection.title: System Connection
system-connection.description: Configure connections to the database and the Asterisk telephony server.

userJourney.title: Journey: Initial System Configuration
steps: The administrator goes to 'System Connection'.
In the 'Database' section, they enter the host, port, and credentials.
They click 'Test Connection' and wait for the success indicator.
In the 'Telephony' section, they configure access to the Asterisk Management Interface (AMI).
They also test this connection.
Once both connections are validated, they save the settings and the system is operational.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Passwords are stored encrypted and are never displayed in plain text.
Connection tests attempt a real authentication with the provided credentials.
Changes are only applied after clicking 'Save Changes'.
These settings are critical and should only be modified by a system administrator.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: Use the 'Test Connection' button for each section after entering the information. This ensures the settings are correct before saving them and activating the connection.

api-docs.title: API Documentation
api-docs.description: Consult the complete API documentation for integration and development.

userJourney.title: Journey: Consulting an Endpoint
steps: The SuperAdmin goes to 'Settings' > 'API Documentation'.
They navigate to the 'Users' section.
They click on the 'GET /api/users' endpoint to see its description.
They examine the request body and response examples to understand how to use it.

specs.title: Technical Specifications
points: Access to this page is strictly reserved for users with the 'SuperAdmin' role.
The documentation is read-only.
Provides clear examples for each available endpoint in the API.

simplificationTip.title: Simplification Tip
simplificationTip.content: This page is a technical reference. Use it to understand the application's data structure or to develop integrations with third-party systems.

billing.title: Billing
billing.description: Manage subscriptions and view billing history.

system-settings.title: System
system-settings.description: Configure low-level system settings, such as email sending.
